alert.note: Alert for Garvin; McClain; Pontotoc; Pottawatomie; Seminole (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 9:48AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Garvin, southwestern Seminole, northwestern Pontotoc, Pottawatomie and southeastern McClain Counties through 1030 AM CDT... At 947 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles west of Tecumseh to 3 miles southeast of Wanette to near Pauls Valley. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Shawnee, Tecumseh, Pauls Valley, Wynnewood, Pink, Stratford, Konawa, Maud, Earlsboro, Asher, Tribbey, Wanette, Byars, St. Louis, Brooksville, Macomb, Bethel Acres, Whitebead, Harjo, and Trousdale. This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 66 and 75. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor NOAA Weather Radio, local radio stations or available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
